body: I can fix this today for EF Core Power Tools, if you are interested?

issue.title: Triggers should not be scaffolded with Synapse SQL pools (and others)

repository.name: EFCorePowerTools

body: Fixed for EF Core 7 in latest daily build of EF Core Power Tools, and CLI version rc.2
@ErikEJ  That is probably a good move in general but we're not using power tools so I'm still working on fixing it in the ef core. I will be submitting a PR shortly.

New PR here (tageting main as requested)
https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/31011

PR approved and tests have passed. I don't have permissions to merge it.
I would like to reiterate my request to have this fix backported to 7.x so I can actually use it. Otherwise I'm happy.

issue.title: Fixes scaffolding on Synapse (triggers)

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
This is a replacement for https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/31001 now targeting main.

Fixes #30998

issue.title: [release/7.x] Disable trigger enumeration on Azure Synapse Analytics, where triggers are not supported

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
See https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/sql/overview-features

Fixes #30998

## Description

Azure Synapse databases do not support triggers. We started checking for triggers in EF Core 7, which causes scaffolding from a Synapse database to fail.

## Customer impact

Crash attempting to scaffold from a Synapse database. Workaround is to use the EF Core Power Tools, which have already been fixed.

## How found

Customer reports 7.0

## Regression

Yes.

## Testing

Manual testing.

## Risk

Low. Not quirked, because this is a design-time change.
